greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the least unitary prime divisor of n, or 0 if no such prime divisor exists.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: If A277697(n) = 0, then a(n) = 0, otherwise a(n) = A000040(A277697(n)). - _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 28 2016
example: n = 252100 = 2*2*3*5*5*7*11*11, unitary prime divisors = {3,7}; smallest is 3, so a(252100)=3.
mathematica: ffi[x_] := Flatten[FactorInteger[x]] lf[x_] := Length[FactorInteger[x]] ba[x_] := Table[Part[ffi[x], 2*w-1], {w, 1, lf[x]}] gb[x_] := GCD[ba[x], x/ba[x]] fpg[x_] := Flatten[Position[gb[x], 1]] upd[x_] := Part[ba[x], fpg[x]] mxu[x_] := Max[upd[x]] miu[x_] := Min[upd[x]] Do[If[Equal[upd[n], {}], Print[0]]; If[ !Equal[upd[n], {}], Print[miu[n]]], {n, 2, 256}]
Table[If[Or[n == 1, Length@ # == 0], 0, First@ #] &@ Select[FactorInteger[n][[All, 1]], GCD[#, n/#] == 1 &], {n, 94}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Oct 30 2016 *)
program: a080368 n = if null us then 0 else fst $ head us
where us = filter ((== 1) . snd) $ zip (a027748_row n) (a124010_row n)
from sympy import factorint, prime, primepi, isprime, primefactors
def a055396(n): return 0 if n==1 else a049084(min(primefactors(n)))
def a(n): return 0 if a277697(n)==0 else prime(a277697(n)) # _Indranil Ghosh_, May 16 2017
xref: Cf. A277698 for a variant which gives 1's instead of 0's for numbers with no unitary prime divisors (A001694).
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Feb 21 2003
